compliance_testing: Annual physical security audit; visitor log audit; badge access log review; camera system test; alarm system test; server room access verification; backup storage audit; contractor access audit; access removal upon termination audit
effectiveness_metrics: Percentage of building entrances secure (target: 100%); visitor log completeness (target: 100%); badge audit findings (target: zero unauthorized access); camera coverage (target: 100% of sensitive areas); unauthorized physical access incidents (target: zero); incident response time (target: <1 hour)
related_requirements: HITECH-13417 (Part of security); HITECH-13418-R1 (Safe Harbor); HITECH-13406-R5 (Safe Harbor); Requirement for facility security; Requirement for surveillance
domains_covered: Privacy & Security Protection; Physical Safeguards; Facility Security; Administrative Safeguards; Access Control; Breach Prevention
applicable_sections: Section 13400; Section 13417 (Safeguards); Section 13418 (Safe Harbor); 45 CFR 164.310 (Physical security); Best practice
success_criteria: All building entrances locked; visitors logged with ID verification; employees wear ID badges; server room restricted and logged; backup storage secure; surveillance operational; alarms functional; emergency procedures reviewed; periodic audits completed; unauthorized access prevented
failure_consequences: Failure results in: Data theft through physical access; server/equipment removal; backup theft; OCR enforcement; breach notification if data accessed; corrective action plan; Safe Harbor protection affected; state AG enforcement; individual litigation; physical security investigations; law enforcement involvement; reputational damage
enforcement_authority: HHS OCR; State Attorneys General; Department of Justice; FBI; Law enforcement; Plaintiffs; Facility management

description: Covered entities must implement workstation security policies defining: permitted uses; location; monitoring; protection of unattended workstations; clean desk policy; screen privacy; password protection; automatic logoff; physical security; disposal procedures
regulatory_basis: HIPAA Security Rule 45 CFR 164.310(b); HITECH Best Practice; Industry Standard
technical_details: Workstation policy: permitted uses documented; workstations in secure locations; screen privacy (privacy filters); no shoulder surfing opportunities; clean desk policy (documents secured); unattended workstation timeout; workstation locking procedures; workstation encryption; workstation patching; antivirus updates; firewall protection; screen orientation preventing public viewing; disposal procedures documented; workstation inventory; periodic audit; policy distribution and acknowledgment; training
compliance_testing: Annual workstation security audit; policy compliance audit; clean desk audit; unattended workstation test; screen privacy assessment; encryption verification; patching status verification; disposal procedures audit
effectiveness_metrics: Percentage of workstations compliant with policy (target: 100%); clean desk violations (target: zero); unattended workstation security failures (target: zero); screen privacy compliance (target: 100%); workstation encryption rate (target: 100%); patch compliance rate (target: 100%)
related_requirements: HITECH-13417 (Workstation security as part of safeguards); HITECH-13418-R1; Requirement for access controls; Requirement for physical security
domains_covered: Privacy & Security Protection; Physical Safeguards; Workstation Security; Administrative Safeguards; Clean Desk Policy; Access Control; Breach Prevention
applicable_sections: Section 13400; Section 13417 (Safeguards); Section 13418 (Safe Harbor); 45 CFR 164.310(b) (Workstation use policy); Industry best practice
success_criteria: Workstation policy documented; employees trained; screens private; unattended workstations timeout/lock; clean desk enforced; workstations encrypted; patched and protected; disposal proper; audits completed; violations corrected; continuous improvement
failure_consequences: Failure results in: Data visible to unauthorized people; theft of information from unattended workstations; malware infections; OCR enforcement; breach notification if accessed; corrective action plan; Safe Harbor protection affected; state AG enforcement; employee liability; individual litigation; reputational damage; loss of patient trust
enforcement_authority: HHS OCR; State Attorneys General; Department of Justice; Plaintiffs; Employers; Facilities
